thread.title: UMHB football ranked in top three in both national polls
thread.title_full: UMHB football ranked in top three in both national polls

title: UMHB football ranked in top three in both national polls
text:
UMHB football ranked in top three in both national polls Posted: Updated: 
Belton, Texas – The University of Mary Hardin-Baylor football team held its ground and is once again ranked second and third in the country in the two major NCAA Division III Top 25 Polls this week. The Cru (6-0, 2-0 ASC) stretched its regular season win streak to 60 consecutive victories with a 54-6 win at Louisiana College last Saturday. 
The Cru is ranked second in the country in the fifth American Football Coaches Association Top 25 Poll of the 2015 season. The Cru received two first-place votes and 995 total points from the AFCA. Mount Union holds down the top spot again with 37 first-place votes and 1,042 total points. Hardin-Simmons is ranked 12 th in the nation with 581 total points and Texas Lutheran received votes totaling 42 points. The Cowboys and Bulldogs are the next two opponents up on the UMHB schedule this season. 

“We were happy to go on the road and get another win last Saturday,” Cru head coach Pete Fredenburg said. “Our focus is on getting better each week and we need to continue to make strides in that area. We have areas on this program that we will address this week because it is a big football game. Games like the one we have coming up this week are the ones you look forward to and they are the reason you play and coach, to put yourself in position to play games like this one.” 

UMHB held steady at #3 in the country in the D3football.com Top 25 Poll. The Cru totaled 572 points in that poll. Mount Union took over the #1 ranking with 19 first-place votes and 619 total points and Linfield College is second with the other six first-place votes and 598 total points. Hardin-Simmons is ranked 14 th in the country and Texas Lutheran is ranked 24 th in the nation by D3football.com this week. 

UMHB will return to action with a Top 25 matchup at Crusader Stadium this Saturday. The Cru will host Texas Lutheran University (5-1) for a 1:00 PM kick off in a game with postseason implications for both teams. Sports - Latest News More>>
